bioghist.p: Founded in 1961, Faith and Fine Arts was the inspiration of Sally Lorimer Morris who, along with her mother Mrs. Graeme Lorimer and nine other women, organized a program "to know our Art Museum." Each month, the group selected a section of the museum to explore, accompanied by a member of the Volunteer Guides. The group also attended a regular series of lectures and made visits to other cultural institutions in the area. Faith and Fine Arts has also regularly donated funds to the Museum's Library for the purchase of books.

scopecontent.p: These six scrapbooks documenting the activities of Faith and Fine Arts consist primarily of ephemera and clippings, along with general and annual mailings to the members of Faith and Fine Arts. Brochures, invitations, and programs document the various events hosted by the group, including lectures, tours, and field trips. The scrapbooks include some letters to museum staff, volunteer guides, and staff of other arts organizations; membership lists; photographs of events; and lists of book purchases made possible by the group's gifts to the library.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
